definition: to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: If your website was fallen to counterpoised to perhaps be banned by Baidu, how should you do?
sentences.chinese: 假如你的網站被百度降權了或者封殺了，你該怎麼辦？

sentences.english: As Man Wenjun still acts as image ambassador, should he be blocked or saved?
sentences.chinese: 滿文軍仍任形象大使，該封殺還是救贖？

sentences.english: Did you know which famous star that was forced out by Songmeiling in those years?
sentences.chinese: 知道誰是當年被宋美齡封殺的好萊塢中國女星嗎？

sentences.english: So what did this censorship amount to?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，這種審查封殺了什麼呢？

definition: roll call/to mention sb by name/(to call or praise or criticize sb) by name
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to leave (the stage, an exam room, the playing field etc)/to take part in some activity/to take an examination (in the imperial examination system)
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
to declare to be untrue/to deny
